Abstract univariate prior on model parameter

Source: R/Prior.R
Prior-class.Rd

Prior is an abstract class specifying the interface to be implemented by an prior class. Implementations for PointMassPrior and ContinuousPrior are available.

bounds() returns the range of the support of a prior [TODO: rename support()?]

expectation() evaluates the expected value of a function f depending on only the parameter value with respect to the prior distribution dist.

condition() returns a new object of class prior resulting from conditioning on the given interval.

predictive_pdf() evaluates the predictive pdf of the model specified by a data distribution dist and prior at he given stage-one outcome (returns PMF for discrete priors).

predictive_cdf() evaluates the predictive cdf of the model specified by a data distribution dist and prior at he given stage-one outcome.

posterior() returns a new prior distribution [TODO: okay, maybe rethink naming?] resulting from conditioning on a given stage-one outcome.

bounds(dist, ...)

expectation(dist, f, ...)

condition(dist, interval, ...)

predictive_pdf(dist, prior, x1, n1, ...)

predictive_cdf(dist, prior, x1, n1, ...)

posterior(dist, prior, x1, n1, ...)

Arguments

dist

a distribution object of class Prior or DataDistribution
f

a function of the single model parameter
interval

length two numeric vector giving the parameter interval to condition on
prior

a distribution object of class Prior
x1

stage-one outcome
n1

stage-one sample size

  • Arguments
